conclusion: Analyze forces on top sphere (D) to find pressure on bottom spheres (A, B, C)
Four spheres arranged in cone shape; bottom spheres in contact with each other and surface; top sphere in equilibrium and in contact with bottom spheres
Distance between centers of adjacent spheres is 2r; angle between lines connecting centers is 120 degrees
Top sphere (D) is in equilibrium; forces acting on it must balance
Weight of top sphere is mg
Normal forces from bottom spheres and weight act on top sphere
Vertical component of normal force is N cos(30 degrees)
Total vertical component of normal forces is 3N cos(30 degrees) = 3N * sqrt(3)/2 = 3sqrt(3)/2 N
Total vertical component must equal weight of top sphere: 3sqrt(3)/2 N = mg implies N = 2mg/3sqrt(3) = 2mg*sqrt(3)/9
Pressure is normal force per unit area
Pressure exerted by top sphere on each bottom sphere is 2mg/3r
